Enumeration Type Documentation

enum souffle::BinaryConstraintOp
strong

Binary Constraint Operators.

Enumerator
__UNDEFINED__ 
EQ 
NE 
LT 
LE 
GT 
GE 
MATCH 
CONTAINS 
NOT_MATCH 
NOT_CONTAINS 

Definition at line 30 of file BinaryConstraintOps.h.

30  {
31  __UNDEFINED__, // undefined operator
32  EQ, // equivalence of two values
33  NE, // whether two values are different
34  LT, // less-than
35  LE, // less-than-or-equal-to
36  GT, // greater-than
37  GE, // greater-than-or-equal-to
38  MATCH, // matching string
39  CONTAINS, // whether a sub-string is contained in a string
40  NOT_MATCH, // not matching string
41  NOT_CONTAINS // whether a sub-string is not contained in a string
42 };

315  bool relationsAdded = false;

317 
318  for (AstRelationIdentifier relName : relations) {
319  // Add the relation itself
320  result.insert(relName);
321  }
322 
323  // Add in all relations that need to use an ignored relation
324  for (AstRelation* rel : program->getRelations()) {
325  for (AstClause* clause : rel->getClauses()) {
326  AstRelationIdentifier clauseHeadName = clause->getHead()->getName();
327  if (!contains(relations, clauseHeadName)) {
328  // Clause hasn't been added yet, so check if it needs to be added
329  visitDepthFirst(*clause, [&](const AstAtom& subatom) {
330  AstRelationIdentifier atomName = subatom.getName();

332  // Clause uses one of the given relations
333  result.insert(clauseHeadName);
334

336  relationsAdded = true;
337  }
338  });
339  }
340  }
341  }
342

388  // get a set of all relations specified by the option
389  std::set<std::string> specifiedRelations = split(Global::config().get("magic-transform"), ',');
390

392  if (contains(specifiedRelations, "*")) {
393  return relations;
394  }
395 
396  // find all specified relations
397  std::set<AstRelationIdentifier> targetRelations;
398  for (AstRelation* rel : program->getRelations()) {
399  std::string mainName = rel->getName().getNames()[0];
400  if (contains(specifiedRelations, mainName)) {
401  targetRelations.insert(rel->getName());
402  }
403  }
404

406  // if we want to magic transform 'a', then we also have to magic transform

409

BindingStore souffle::bindComposites ( const AstProgram *  program)

Definition at line 610 of file MagicSet.cpp.

References souffle::BindingStore::addBinding(), constraints, EQ, souffle::AstProgram::getRelations(), and node.

Referenced by souffle::Adornment::run().

610  {
611  struct M : public AstNodeMapper {
612  BindingStore& compositeBindings;
613  std::set<AstConstraint*>& constraints;
614  mutable int changeCount;
615 
616  M(BindingStore& compositeBindings, std::set<AstConstraint*>& constraints, int changeCount)
617  : compositeBindings(compositeBindings), constraints(constraints), changeCount(changeCount) {}
618 
619  int getChangeCount() const {
620  return changeCount;
621  }
622 
623  std::unique_ptr<AstNode> operator()(std::unique_ptr<AstNode> node) const override {
624  if (AstFunctor* functor = dynamic_cast<AstFunctor*>(node.get())) {
625  // functor found
626  changeCount++;
627 
628  // create new variable name (with appropriate suffix)
629  std::stringstream newVariableName;
630  newVariableName << "+functor" << changeCount;
631 
632  // add the binding to the BindingStore
633  compositeBindings.addBinding(newVariableName.str(), functor);
634 
635  // create new constraint (+functorX = original-functor)
636  auto newVariable = std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVariableName.str());
637  constraints.insert(new AstConstraint(BinaryConstraintOp::EQ,
638  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newVariable->clone()),
639  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->clone())));
640 
641  // update functor to be the variable created
642  return std::move(newVariable);
643  } else if (AstRecordInit* record = dynamic_cast<AstRecordInit*>(node.get())) {
644  // record found
645  changeCount++;
646 
647  // create new variable name (with appropriate suffix)
648  std::stringstream newVariableName;
649  newVariableName << "+record" << changeCount;
650 
651  // add the binding to the BindingStore
652  compositeBindings.addBinding(newVariableName.str(), record);
653 
654  // create new constraint (+recordX = original-record)
655  auto newVariable = std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVariableName.str());
656  constraints.insert(new AstConstraint(BinaryConstraintOp::EQ,
657  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newVariable->clone()),
658  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(record->clone())));
659 
660  // update record to be the variable created
661  return std::move(newVariable);
662  }
663  node->apply(*this);
664  return node;
665  }
666  };
667 
668  BindingStore compositeBindings;
669 
670  int changeCount = 0; // number of functors/records seen so far
671 
672  // apply the change to all clauses in the program
673  for (AstRelation* rel : program->getRelations()) {
674  for (AstClause* clause : rel->getClauses()) {
675  std::set<AstConstraint*> constraints;
676  M update(compositeBindings, constraints, changeCount);
677  clause->apply(update);
678 
679  changeCount = update.getChangeCount();
680 
681  for (AstConstraint* constraint : constraints) {
682  clause->addToBody(std::unique_ptr<AstConstraint>(constraint));
683  }
684  }
685  }
686 
687  return compositeBindings;
688 }
node
const RamNode & node
Definition: Synthesiser.cpp:268
constraints
Problem< AnalysisVar > constraints
The list of constraints making underlying this analysis.
Definition: AstTypeAnalysis.cpp:64

std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*> > souffle::combineNegatedLiterals ( std::vector< std::vector< AstLiteral * >>  litGroups)

Return the negated version of a disjunction of conjunctions.

E.g. (a1(x) ^ a2(x) ^ ...) v (b1(x) ^ b2(x) ^ ...) –into-> (!a1(x) ^ !b1(x)) v (!a2(x) ^ !b2(x)) v ...

Definition at line 321 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References negateLiteral().

Referenced by formNegatedLiterals().

322  {
323  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> negation;
324 
325  // Corner case: !() = ()
326  if (litGroups.empty()) {
327  return negation;
328  }
329 
330  std::vector<AstLiteral*> litGroup = litGroups[0];
331  if (litGroups.size() == 1) {
332  // !(a1 ^ a2 ^ a3 ^ ...) --into-> !a1 v !a2 v !a3 v ...
333  for (size_t i = 0; i < litGroup.size(); i++) {
334  std::vector<AstLiteral*> newVec;
335  newVec.push_back(negateLiteral(litGroup[i]));
336  negation.push_back(newVec);
337  }
338 
339  // Done!
340  return negation;
341  }
342 
343  // Produce the negated versions of all disjunctions ignoring the first recursively
344  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> combinedRHS = combineNegatedLiterals(
345  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>>(litGroups.begin() + 1, litGroups.end()));
346 
347  // We now just need to add the negation of a single literal from the untouched LHS
348  // to every single conjunction on the RHS to finalise creating every possible combination
349  for (AstLiteral* lhsLit : litGroup) {
350  for (std::vector<AstLiteral*> rhsVec : combinedRHS) {
351  std::vector<AstLiteral*> newVec;
352  newVec.push_back(negateLiteral(lhsLit));
353 
354  for (AstLiteral* lit : rhsVec) {
355  newVec.push_back(lit->clone());
356  }
357 
358  negation.push_back(newVec);
359  }
360  }
361 
362  return negation;
363 }
souffle::combineNegatedLiterals

Return the negated version of a disjunction of conjunctions.

std::string souffle::dirName ( const std::string &  name)
inline

C++-style dirname.

Definition at line 985 of file Util.h.

985  {
986  if (name.empty()) {
987  return ".";
988  }
989  size_t lastNotSlash = name.find_last_not_of('/');
990  // All '/'
991  if (lastNotSlash == std::string::npos) {
992  return "/";
993  }
994  size_t leadingSlash = name.find_last_of('/', lastNotSlash);
995  // No '/'
996  if (leadingSlash == std::string::npos) {
997  return ".";
998  }
999  // dirname is '/'
1000  if (leadingSlash == 0) {
1001  return "/";
1002  }
1003  return name.substr(0, leadingSlash);
1004 }

298  return true;

310  return false;

bool souffle::equal ( const std::set< T > &  a,
const std::set< T > &  b,
const Comp &  comp = Comp()

A function testing whether two sets are equal (same set of elements).

349  {
350  // check reference
351  if (&a == &b) {
352  return true;

357  return false;

366  }

368  }

std::string souffle::fileExtension ( const std::string &  path)

Definition at line 1083 of file Util.h.

1083  {
1084  std::string name = path;
1085  const size_t lastDot = name.find_last_of('.');
1086  // file has no extension
1087  if (lastDot == std::string::npos) return std::string();
1088  const size_t lastSlash = name.find_last_of('/');
1089  // last slash occurs after last dot, so no extension
1090  if (lastSlash != std::string::npos && lastSlash > lastDot) return std::string();

1092  return name.substr(lastDot + 1);
1093 }

std::vector<AstRelationIdentifier> souffle::findInlineCycle ( const PrecedenceGraph &  precedenceGraph,
std::map< const AstRelation *, const AstRelation * > &  origins,
const AstRelation *  current,
AstRelationSet &  unvisited,
AstRelationSet &  visiting,
AstRelationSet &  visited 
)

Find a cycle consisting entirely of inlined relations.

If no cycle exists, then an empty vector is returned.

Definition at line 858 of file AstSemanticChecker.cpp.

References souffle::AstRelation::getName(), and souffle::PrecedenceGraph::graph().

Referenced by souffle::AstSemanticChecker::checkInlining().

860  {
861  std::vector<AstRelationIdentifier> result;
862 
863  if (current == nullptr) {
864  // Not looking at any nodes at the moment, so choose any node from the unvisited list
865 
866  if (unvisited.empty()) {
867  // Nothing left to visit - so no cycles exist!
868  return result;
869  }
870 
871  // Choose any element from the unvisited set
872  current = *unvisited.begin();
873  origins[current] = nullptr;
874 
875  // Move it to "currently visiting"
876  unvisited.erase(current);
877  visiting.insert(current);
878 
879  // Check if we can find a cycle beginning from this node
880  std::vector<AstRelationIdentifier> subresult =
881  findInlineCycle(precedenceGraph, origins, current, unvisited, visiting, visited);
882 
883  if (subresult.empty()) {
884  // No cycle found, try again from another node
885  return findInlineCycle(precedenceGraph, origins, nullptr, unvisited, visiting, visited);
886  } else {
887  // Cycle found! Return it
888  return subresult;
889  }
890  }
891 
892  // Check neighbours
893  const AstRelationSet& successors = precedenceGraph.graph().successors(current);
894  for (const AstRelation* successor : successors) {
895  // Only care about inlined neighbours in the graph
896  if (successor->isInline()) {
897  if (visited.find(successor) != visited.end()) {
898  // The neighbour has already been visited, so move on
899  continue;
900  }
901 
902  if (visiting.find(successor) != visiting.end()) {
903  // Found a cycle!!
904  // Construct the cycle in reverse
905  while (current != nullptr) {
906  result.push_back(current->getName());
907  current = origins[current];
908  }
909  return result;
910  }
911 
912  // Node has not been visited yet
913  origins[successor] = current;
914 
915  // Move from unvisited to visiting
916  unvisited.erase(successor);
917  visiting.insert(successor);
918 
919  // Visit recursively and check if a cycle is formed
920  std::vector<AstRelationIdentifier> subgraphCycle =
921  findInlineCycle(precedenceGraph, origins, successor, unvisited, visiting, visited);
922 
923  if (!subgraphCycle.empty()) {
924  // Found a cycle!
925  return subgraphCycle;
926  }
927  }
928  }
929 
930  // Visited all neighbours with no cycle found, so done visiting this node.
931  visiting.erase(current);
932  visited.insert(current);
933  return result;
934 }

Definition: Util.h:1009
std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*> > souffle::formNegatedLiterals ( AstProgram &  program,
AstAtom *  atom 
)

Forms the bodies that will replace the negation of a given inlined atom.

E.g. a(x) <- (a11(x), a12(x)) ; (a21(x), a22(x)) => !a(x) <- (!a11(x), !a21(x)) ; (!a11(x), !a22(x)) ; ... Essentially, produce every combination (m_1 ^ m_2 ^ ...) where m_i is the negation of a literal in the ith rule of a.

Definition at line 371 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References combineNegatedLiterals(), souffle::AstAtom::getName(), souffle::AstProgram::getRelation(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::getVector(), inlineBodyLiterals(), and souffle::NullableVector< T >::isValid().

Referenced by getInlinedLiteral().

371  {
372  // Constraints added to unify atoms should not be negated and should be added to
373  // all the final rule combinations produced, and so should be stored separately.
374  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> addedBodyLiterals;
375  std::vector<std::vector<AstConstraint*>> addedConstraints;
376 
377  // Go through every possible clause associated with the given atom
378  for (AstClause* inClause : program.getRelation(atom->getName())->getClauses()) {
379  // Form the replacement clause by inlining based on the current clause
380  std::pair<NullableVector<AstLiteral*>, std::vector<AstConstraint*>> inlineResult =
381  inlineBodyLiterals(atom, inClause);
382  NullableVector<AstLiteral*> replacementBodyLiterals = inlineResult.first;
383  std::vector<AstConstraint*> currConstraints = inlineResult.second;
384 
385  if (!replacementBodyLiterals.isValid()) {
386  // Failed to unify, so just move on
387  continue;
388  }
389 
390  addedBodyLiterals.push_back(replacementBodyLiterals.getVector());
391  addedConstraints.push_back(currConstraints);
392  }
393 
394  // We now have a list of bodies needed to inline the given atom.
395  // We want to inline the negated version, however, which is done using De Morgan's Law.
396  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> negatedAddedBodyLiterals =
397  combineNegatedLiterals(addedBodyLiterals);
398 
399  // Add in the necessary constraints to all the body literals
400  for (size_t i = 0; i < negatedAddedBodyLiterals.size(); i++) {
401  for (std::vector<AstConstraint*> constraintGroup : addedConstraints) {
402  for (AstConstraint* constraint : constraintGroup) {
403  negatedAddedBodyLiterals[i].push_back(constraint->clone());
404  }
405  }
406  }
407 
408  // Free up the old body literals and constraints
409  for (std::vector<AstLiteral*> litGroup : addedBodyLiterals) {
410  for (AstLiteral* lit : litGroup) {
411  delete lit;
412  }
413  }
414  for (std::vector<AstConstraint*> consGroup : addedConstraints) {
415  for (AstConstraint* cons : consGroup) {
416  delete cons;
417  }
418  }
419 
420  return negatedAddedBodyLiterals;
421 }

87  {
88  if (symbol == "+") return BinaryOp::ADD;
89  if (symbol == "-") return BinaryOp::SUB;

91  if (symbol == "/") return BinaryOp::DIV;
92  if (symbol == "^") return BinaryOp::EXP;
93  if (symbol == "%") return BinaryOp::MOD;
94  if (symbol == "band") return BinaryOp::BAND;

96  if (symbol == "bxor") return BinaryOp::BXOR;
97  if (symbol == "land") return BinaryOp::LAND;
98  if (symbol == "lor") return BinaryOp::LOR;
99  if (symbol == "max") return BinaryOp::MAX;
100  if (symbol == "min") return BinaryOp::MIN;
101  if (symbol == "cat") return BinaryOp::CAT;
102  std::cout << "Unrecognised operator: " << symbol << "\n";
103  assert(false && "Unsupported Operator!");
104  return BinaryOp::__UNDEFINED__;
105 }

Parameters

Definition at line 247 of file AstTypeAnalysis.cpp.

References EQ, souffle::AstTernaryFunctor::getArg(), souffle::AstRecordInit::getArguments(), souffle::AstConstraint::getLHS(), souffle::AstBinaryFunctor::getLHS(), souffle::AstUnaryFunctor::getOperand(), souffle::AstConstraint::getOperator(), souffle::AstConstraint::getRHS(), souffle::AstBinaryFunctor::getRHS(), lhs, pack(), and rhs.

247  {
248  // define analysis ..
249  struct Analysis : public AstConstraintAnalysis<BoolDisjunctVar> {
250  // #1 - constants are constant
251  void visitConstant(const AstConstant& cur) override {
252  // this is a constant value
253  addConstraint(isTrue(getVar(cur)));
254  }
255 
256  // #2 - binary relations may propagate const
257  void visitConstraint(const AstConstraint& cur) override {
258  // only target equality
259  if (cur.getOperator() != BinaryConstraintOp::EQ) {
260  return;
261  }
262 
263  // if equal, link right and left side
264  auto lhs = getVar(cur.getLHS());
265  auto rhs = getVar(cur.getRHS());
266 
267  addConstraint(imply(lhs, rhs));
268  addConstraint(imply(rhs, lhs));
269  }
270 
271  // #3 - const is propagated via unary functors
272  void visitUnaryFunctor(const AstUnaryFunctor& cur) override {
273  auto fun = getVar(cur);
274  auto op = getVar(cur.getOperand());
275 
276  addConstraint(imply(op, fun));
277  }
278 
279  // #4 - const is propagated via binary functors
280  void visitBinaryFunctor(const AstBinaryFunctor& cur) override {
281  auto fun = getVar(cur);
282  auto lhs = getVar(cur.getLHS());
283  auto rhs = getVar(cur.getRHS());
284 
285  addConstraint(imply({lhs, rhs}, fun));
286  addConstraint(imply({fun, lhs}, rhs));
287  addConstraint(imply({fun, rhs}, lhs));
288  }
289 
290  // #5 - const is propagated via ternary functors
291  void visitTernaryFunctor(const AstTernaryFunctor& cur) override {
292  auto fun = getVar(cur);
293  auto a0 = getVar(cur.getArg(0));
294  auto a1 = getVar(cur.getArg(1));
295  auto a2 = getVar(cur.getArg(2));
296 
297  addConstraint(imply({a0, a1, a2}, fun));
298  }
299 
300  // #6 - if pack nodes and its components
301  void visitRecordInit(const AstRecordInit& init) override {
302  auto pack = getVar(init);
303 
304  std::vector<BoolDisjunctVar> subs;
305  for (const auto& cur : init.getArguments()) {
306  subs.push_back(getVar(cur));
307  }
308 
309  // link vars in both directions
310  addConstraint(imply(subs, pack));
311  for (const auto& c : subs) {
312  addConstraint(imply(pack, c));
313  }
314  }
315  };
316 
317  // run analysis on given clause
318  return Analysis().analyse(clause);
319 }

Here is the call graph for this function:

TypeSet souffle::getGreatestCommonSubtypes ( const Type &  a,
const Type &  b 
)

Computes the greatest common sub types of the two given types.

Definition at line 504 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References souffle::UnionType::getElementTypes(), souffle::Type::getTypeEnvironment(), souffle::TypeSet::insert(), isSubtypeOf(), and souffle::TypeEnvironment::isType().

Referenced by getGreatestCommonSubtypes().

504  {
505  // make sure they are in the same type environment
506  assert(a.getTypeEnvironment().isType(a) && a.getTypeEnvironment().isType(b));
507 
508  // if they are equal it is easy
509  if (a == b) {
510  return TypeSet(a);
511  }
512 
513  // equally simple - check whether one is a sub-type of the other
514  if (isSubtypeOf(a, b)) {
515  return TypeSet(a);
516  }
517  if (isSubtypeOf(b, a)) {
518  return TypeSet(b);
519  }
520 
521  // last option: if both are unions with common sub-types
522  TypeSet res;
523  if (isUnion(a) && isUnion(b)) {
524  // collect common sub-types of union types
525 
526  struct collector : public TypeVisitor<void> {
527  const Type& b;
528  TypeSet& res;
529  collector(const Type& b, TypeSet& res) : b(b), res(res) {}
530  void visit(const Type& type) const override {
531  if (isSubtypeOf(type, b)) {
532  res.insert(type);
533  } else {
534  TypeVisitor<void>::visit(type);
535  }
536  }
537  void visitUnionType(const UnionType& type) const override {
538  for (const auto& cur : type.getElementTypes()) {
539  visit(*cur);
540  }
541  }
542  };
543 
544  // collect all common sub-types
545  collector(b, res).visit(a);
546  }
547 
548  // otherwise there is no common super type
549  return res;
550 }
souffle::isSubtypeOf
bool isSubtypeOf(const Type &a, const Type &b)
Determines whether type a is a subtype of type b.

TypeSet souffle::getGreatestCommonSubtypes ( const TypeSet &  set)

Computes the greatest common sub types of all the types in the given set.

Definition at line 552 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References souffle::TypeSet::begin(), souffle::TypeSet::empty(), souffle::TypeSet::end(), getGreatestCommonSubtypes(), souffle::TypeSet::insert(), and souffle::TypeSet::isAll().

552  {
553  // handle the empty set
554  if (set.empty()) {
555  return set;
556  }
557 
558  // handle the all set => empty set (since no common sub-type)
559  if (set.isAll()) {
560  return TypeSet();
561  }
562 
563  TypeSet res;
564  auto it = set.begin();
565  res.insert(*it);
566  ++it;
567 
568  // refine sub-set step by step
569  for (; it != set.end(); ++it) {
570  TypeSet tmp;
571  for (const Type& cur : res) {
572  tmp.insert(getGreatestCommonSubtypes(cur, *it));
573  }
574  res = tmp;
575  }
576 
577  // done
578  return res;
579 }
souffle::getGreatestCommonSubtypes
TypeSet getGreatestCommonSubtypes(const TypeSet &a, const TypeSet &b)
The set of pair-wise greatest common sub types of the types in the two given sets.

Here is the call graph for this function:

TypeSet souffle::getGreatestCommonSubtypes ( const TypeSet &  a,
const TypeSet &  b 
)

The set of pair-wise greatest common sub types of the types in the two given sets.

Definition at line 581 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References souffle::TypeSet::empty(), getGreatestCommonSubtypes(), souffle::TypeSet::insert(), and souffle::TypeSet::isAll().

581  {
582  // special cases
583  if (a.empty()) {
584  return a;
585  }
586  if (b.empty()) {
587  return b;
588  }
589 
590  if (a.isAll()) {
591  return b;
592  }
593  if (b.isAll()) {
594  return a;
595  }
596 
597  // compute pairwise greatest common sub types
598  TypeSet res;
599  for (const Type& x : a) {
600  for (const Type& y : b) {
601  res.insert(getGreatestCommonSubtypes(x, y));
602  }
603  }
604  return res;
605 }

std::map< const AstArgument *, bool > souffle::getGroundedTerms ( const AstClause &  clause)

Analyse the given clause and computes for each contained argument whether it is a grounded value or not.

Parameters
clausethe clause to be analyzed
Returns
a map mapping each contained argument to a boolean indicating whether the argument represents a grounded value or not

Definition at line 321 of file AstTypeAnalysis.cpp.

References EQ, souffle::AstAtom::getArguments(), souffle::AstRecordInit::getArguments(), souffle::AstNegation::getAtom(), souffle::AstClause::getHead(), souffle::AstConstraint::getLHS(), souffle::AstConstraint::getOperator(), souffle::AstConstraint::getRHS(), lhs, and rhs.

Referenced by souffle::AstSemanticChecker::checkProgram(), and usesInvalidWitness().

321  {
322  // define analysis ..
323  struct Analysis : public AstConstraintAnalysis<BoolDisjunctVar> {
324  std::set<const AstAtom*> ignore;
325 
326  // #1 - atoms are producing grounded variables
327  void visitAtom(const AstAtom& cur) override {
328  // some atoms need to be skipped (head or negation)
329  if (ignore.find(&cur) != ignore.end()) {
330  return;
331  }
332 
333  // all arguments are grounded
334  for (const auto& arg : cur.getArguments()) {
335  addConstraint(isTrue(getVar(arg)));
336  }
337  }
338 
339  // #2 - negations need to be skipped
340  void visitNegation(const AstNegation& cur) override {
341  // add nested atom to black-list
342  ignore.insert(cur.getAtom());
343  }
344 
345  // #3 - also skip head
346  void visitClause(const AstClause& clause) override {
347  // ignore head
348  ignore.insert(clause.getHead());
349  }
350 
351  // #4 - binary equality relations propagates groundness
352  void visitConstraint(const AstConstraint& cur) override {
353  // only target equality
354  if (cur.getOperator() != BinaryConstraintOp::EQ) {
355  return;
356  }
357 
358  // if equal, link right and left side
359  auto lhs = getVar(cur.getLHS());
360  auto rhs = getVar(cur.getRHS());
361 
362  addConstraint(imply(lhs, rhs));
363  addConstraint(imply(rhs, lhs));
364  }
365 
366  // #5 - record init nodes
367  void visitRecordInit(const AstRecordInit& init) override {
368  auto cur = getVar(init);
369 
370  std::vector<BoolDisjunctVar> vars;
371 
372  // if record is grounded, so are all its arguments
373  for (const auto& arg : init.getArguments()) {
374  auto arg_var = getVar(arg);
375  addConstraint(imply(cur, arg_var));
376  vars.push_back(arg_var);
377  }
378 
379  // if all arguments are grounded, so is the record
380  addConstraint(imply(vars, cur));
381  }
382 
383  // #6 - constants are also sources of grounded values
384  void visitConstant(const AstConstant& c) override {
385  addConstraint(isTrue(getVar(c)));
386  }
387 
388  // #7 - aggregators are grounding values
389  void visitAggregator(const AstAggregator& c) override {
390  addConstraint(isTrue(getVar(c)));
391  }
392  };
393 
394  // run analysis on given clause
395  return Analysis().analyse(clause);
396 }
lhs
std::unique_ptr< AstArgument > lhs
The two terms to be equivalent.
Definition: AstTransforms.cpp:169
rhs
std::unique_ptr< AstArgument > rhs
Definition: AstTransforms.cpp:170

NullableVector<AstArgument*> souffle::getInlinedArgument ( AstProgram &  program,
const AstArgument *  arg 
)

Returns a vector of arguments that should replace the given argument after one step of inlining.

Note: This function is currently generalised to perform any required inlining within aggregators as well, making it simple to extend to this later on if desired (and the semantic check is removed).

Definition at line 474 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References ADD, souffle::AstRecordInit::add(), souffle::AstAggregator::addBodyLiteral(), combineAggregators(), souffle::AstAggregator::count, getInlinedLiteral(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::getVector(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::isValid(), MAX, souffle::AstAggregator::max, MIN, souffle::AstAggregator::min, souffle::AstAggregator::setTargetExpression(), and souffle::AstAggregator::sum.

Referenced by getInlinedAtom(), and getInlinedLiteral().

474  {
475  bool changed = false;
476  std::vector<AstArgument*> versions;
477 
478  // Each argument has to be handled differently - essentially, want to go down to
479  // nested aggregators, and inline their bodies if needed.
480  if (const AstAggregator* aggr = dynamic_cast<const AstAggregator*>(arg)) {
481  // First try inlining the target expression if necessary
482  if (aggr->getTargetExpression() != nullptr) {
483  NullableVector<AstArgument*> argumentVersions =
484  getInlinedArgument(program, aggr->getTargetExpression());
485 
486  if (argumentVersions.isValid()) {
487  // An element in the target expression can be inlined!
488  changed = true;
489 
490  // Create a new aggregator per version of the target expression
491  for (AstArgument* newArg : argumentVersions.getVector()) {
492  AstAggregator* newAggr = new AstAggregator(aggr->getOperator());
493  newAggr->setTargetExpression(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newArg));
494  for (AstLiteral* lit : aggr->getBodyLiterals()) {
495  newAggr->addBodyLiteral(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(lit->clone()));
496  }
497  versions.push_back(newAggr);
498  }
499  }
500  }
501 
502  // Try inlining body arguments if the target expression has not been changed.
503  // (At this point we only handle one step of inlining at a time)
504  if (!changed) {
505  std::vector<AstLiteral*> bodyLiterals = aggr->getBodyLiterals();
506  for (size_t i = 0; i < bodyLiterals.size(); i++) {
507  AstLiteral* currLit = bodyLiterals[i];
508 
509  NullableVector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> literalVersions =
510  getInlinedLiteral(program, currLit);
511 
512  if (literalVersions.isValid()) {
513  // Literal can be inlined!
514  changed = true;
515 
516  AstAggregator::Op op = aggr->getOperator();
517 
518  // Create an aggregator (with the same operation) for each possible body
519  std::vector<AstAggregator*> aggrVersions;
520  for (std::vector<AstLiteral*> inlineVersions : literalVersions.getVector()) {
521  AstAggregator* newAggr = new AstAggregator(aggr->getOperator());
522  if (aggr->getTargetExpression() != nullptr) {
523  newAggr->setTargetExpression(
524  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(aggr->getTargetExpression()->clone()));
525  }
526 
527  // Add in everything except the current literal being replaced
528  for (size_t j = 0; j < bodyLiterals.size(); j++) {
529  if (i != j) {
530  newAggr->addBodyLiteral(
531  std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(bodyLiterals[j]->clone()));
532  }
533  }
534 
535  // Add in everything new that replaces that literal
536  for (AstLiteral* addedLit : inlineVersions) {
537  newAggr->addBodyLiteral(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(addedLit));
538  }
539 
540  aggrVersions.push_back(newAggr);
541  }
542 
543  // Create the actual overall aggregator that ties the replacement aggregators together.
544  if (op == AstAggregator::min) {
545  // min x : { a(x) }. <=> min ( min x : { a1(x) }, min x : { a2(x) }, ... )
546  versions.push_back(combineAggregators(aggrVersions, BinaryOp::MIN));
547  } else if (op == AstAggregator::max) {
548  // max x : { a(x) }. <=> max ( max x : { a1(x) }, max x : { a2(x) }, ... )
549  versions.push_back(combineAggregators(aggrVersions, BinaryOp::MAX));
550  } else if (op == AstAggregator::count) {
551  // count : { a(x) }. <=> sum ( count : { a1(x) }, count : { a2(x) }, ... )
552  versions.push_back(combineAggregators(aggrVersions, BinaryOp::ADD));
553  } else if (op == AstAggregator::sum) {
554  // sum x : { a(x) }. <=> sum ( sum x : { a1(x) }, sum x : { a2(x) }, ... )
555  versions.push_back(combineAggregators(aggrVersions, BinaryOp::ADD));
556  } else {
557  assert(false && "Unsupported aggregator type");
558  }
559  }
560 
561  // Only perform one stage of inlining at a time.
562  if (changed) {
563  break;
564  }
565  }
566  }
567  } else if (dynamic_cast<const AstFunctor*>(arg)) {
568  // Each type of functor (unary, binary, ternary) must be handled differently.
569  if (const AstUnaryFunctor* functor = dynamic_cast<const AstUnaryFunctor*>(arg)) {
570  NullableVector<AstArgument*> argumentVersions =
571  getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getOperand());
572  if (argumentVersions.isValid()) {
573  changed = true;
574  for (AstArgument* newArg : argumentVersions.getVector()) {
575  AstArgument* newFunctor =
576  new AstUnaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(), std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newArg));
577  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
578  }
579  }
580  } else if (const AstBinaryFunctor* functor = dynamic_cast<const AstBinaryFunctor*>(arg)) {
581  NullableVector<AstArgument*> lhsVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getLHS());
582  if (lhsVersions.isValid()) {
583  changed = true;
584  for (AstArgument* newLhs : lhsVersions.getVector()) {
585  AstArgument* newFunctor =
586  new AstBinaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(), std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newLhs),
587  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getRHS()->clone()));
588  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
589  }
590  } else {
591  NullableVector<AstArgument*> rhsVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getRHS());
592  if (rhsVersions.isValid()) {
593  changed = true;
594  for (AstArgument* newRhs : rhsVersions.getVector()) {
595  AstArgument* newFunctor = new AstBinaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(),
596  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getLHS()->clone()),
597  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newRhs));
598  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
599  }
600  }
601  }
602  } else if (const AstTernaryFunctor* functor = dynamic_cast<const AstTernaryFunctor*>(arg)) {
603  NullableVector<AstArgument*> leftVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getArg(0));
604  if (leftVersions.isValid()) {
605  changed = true;
606  for (AstArgument* newLeft : leftVersions.getVector()) {
607  AstArgument* newFunctor = new AstTernaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(),
608  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newLeft),
609  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(1)->clone()),
610  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(2)->clone()));
611  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
612  }
613  } else {
614  NullableVector<AstArgument*> middleVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getArg(1));
615  if (middleVersions.isValid()) {
616  changed = true;
617  for (AstArgument* newMiddle : middleVersions.getVector()) {
618  AstArgument* newFunctor = new AstTernaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(),
619  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(0)->clone()),
620  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newMiddle),
621  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(2)->clone()));
622  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
623  }
624  } else {
625  NullableVector<AstArgument*> rightVersions =
626  getInlinedArgument(program, functor->getArg(2));
627  if (rightVersions.isValid()) {
628  changed = true;
629  for (AstArgument* newRight : rightVersions.getVector()) {
630  AstArgument* newFunctor = new AstTernaryFunctor(functor->getFunction(),
631  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(0)->clone()),
632  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(functor->getArg(1)->clone()),
633  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newRight));
634  versions.push_back(newFunctor);
635  }
636  }
637  }
638  }
639  }
640  } else if (const AstTypeCast* cast = dynamic_cast<const AstTypeCast*>(arg)) {
641  NullableVector<AstArgument*> argumentVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, cast->getValue());
642  if (argumentVersions.isValid()) {
643  changed = true;
644  for (AstArgument* newArg : argumentVersions.getVector()) {
645  AstArgument* newTypeCast =
646  new AstTypeCast(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newArg), cast->getType());
647  versions.push_back(newTypeCast);
648  }
649  }
650  } else if (const AstRecordInit* record = dynamic_cast<const AstRecordInit*>(arg)) {
651  std::vector<AstArgument*> recordArguments = record->getArguments();
652  for (size_t i = 0; i < recordArguments.size(); i++) {
653  AstArgument* currentRecArg = recordArguments[i];
654  NullableVector<AstArgument*> argumentVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, currentRecArg);
655  if (argumentVersions.isValid()) {
656  changed = true;
657  for (AstArgument* newArgumentVersion : argumentVersions.getVector()) {
658  AstRecordInit* newRecordArg = new AstRecordInit();
659  for (size_t j = 0; j < recordArguments.size(); j++) {
660  if (i == j) {
661  newRecordArg->add(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newArgumentVersion));
662  } else {
663  newRecordArg->add(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(recordArguments[j]->clone()));
664  }
665  }
666  versions.push_back(newRecordArg);
667  }
668  }
669 
670  // Only perform one stage of inlining at a time.
671  if (changed) {
672  break;
673  }
674  }
675  }
676 
677  if (changed) {
678  // Return a valid vector - replacements need to be made!
679  return NullableVector<AstArgument*>(versions);
680  } else {
681  // Return an invalid vector - no inlining has occurred
682  return NullableVector<AstArgument*>();
683  }
684 }

NullableVector<AstAtom*> souffle::getInlinedAtom ( AstProgram &  program,
AstAtom &  atom 
)

Returns a vector of atoms that should replace the given atom after one step of inlining.

Assumes the relation the atom belongs to is not inlined itself.

Definition at line 690 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References souffle::AstAtom::clone(), souffle::AstAtom::getArguments(), getInlinedArgument(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::getVector(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::isValid(), and souffle::AstAtom::setArgument().

Referenced by getInlinedClause(), and getInlinedLiteral().

690  {
691  bool changed = false;
692  std::vector<AstAtom*> versions;
693 
694  // Try to inline each of the atom's arguments
695  std::vector<AstArgument*> arguments = atom.getArguments();
696  for (size_t i = 0; i < arguments.size(); i++) {
697  AstArgument* arg = arguments[i];
698

700

702  // Argument has replacements
703  changed = true;
704 
705  // Create a new atom per new version of the argument
706  for (AstArgument* newArgument : argumentVersions.getVector()) {
707  AstAtom* newAtom = atom.clone();
708  newAtom->setArgument(i, std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newArgument));
709  versions.push_back(newAtom);
710  }
711  }

714  if (changed) {
715  break;
716  }
717  }
718

720  // Return a valid vector - replacements need to be made!
721  return NullableVector<AstAtom*>(versions);
722  } else {

724  return NullableVector<AstAtom*>();
725  }

Definition: InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp:474

Here is the call graph for this function:

std::vector<AstClause*> souffle::getInlinedClause ( AstProgram &  program,
const AstClause &  clause 
)

Returns a list of clauses that should replace the given clause after one step of inlining.

If no inlining can occur, the list will only contain a clone of the original clause.

Definition at line 863 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References souffle::AstClause::addToBody(), souffle::AstClause::clone(), souffle::AstClause::cloneHead(), souffle::AstClause::getBodyLiterals(), souffle::AstClause::getHead(), getInlinedAtom(), getInlinedLiteral(), souffle::AstNode::getSrcLoc(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::getVector(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::isValid(), souffle::AstClause::setHead(), and souffle::AstNode::setSrcLoc().

Referenced by souffle::InlineRelationsTransformer::transform().

863  {
864  bool changed = false;
865  std::vector<AstClause*> versions;
866 
867  // Try to inline things contained in the arguments of the head first.
868  // E.g. `a(x, max y : { b(y) }) :- c(x).`, where b should be inlined.
869  AstAtom* head = clause.getHead();
870  NullableVector<AstAtom*> headVersions = getInlinedAtom(program, *head);
871  if (headVersions.isValid()) {
872  // The head atom can be inlined!
873  changed = true;
874 
875  // Produce the new clauses with the replacement head atoms
876  for (AstAtom* newHead : headVersions.getVector()) {
877  AstClause* newClause = new AstClause();
878  newClause->setSrcLoc(clause.getSrcLoc());
879 
880  newClause->setHead(std::unique_ptr<AstAtom>(newHead));
881 
882  // The body will remain unchanged
883  for (AstLiteral* lit : clause.getBodyLiterals()) {
884  newClause->addToBody(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(lit->clone()));
885  }
886 
887  versions.push_back(newClause);
888  }
889  }
890 
891  // Only perform one stage of inlining at a time.
892  // If the head atoms did not need inlining, try inlining atoms nested in the body.
893  if (!changed) {
894  std::vector<AstLiteral*> bodyLiterals = clause.getBodyLiterals();
895  for (size_t i = 0; i < bodyLiterals.size(); i++) {
896  AstLiteral* currLit = bodyLiterals[i];
897 
898  // Three possible cases when trying to inline a literal:
899  // 1) The literal itself may be directly inlined. In this case, the atom can be replaced
900  // with multiple different bodies, as the inlined atom may have several rules.
901  // 2) Otherwise, the literal itself may not need to be inlined, but a subnode (e.g. an argument)
902  // may need to be inlined. In this case, an altered literal must replace the original.
903  // Again, several possible versions may exist, as the inlined relation may have several rules.
904  // 3) The literal does not depend on any inlined relations, and so does not need to be changed.
905  NullableVector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> litVersions = getInlinedLiteral(program, currLit);
906 
907  if (litVersions.isValid()) {
908  // Case 1 and 2: Inlining has occurred!
909  changed = true;
910 
911  // The literal may be replaced with several different bodies.
912  // Create a new clause for each possible version.
913  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> bodyVersions = litVersions.getVector();
914 
915  // Create the base clause with the current literal removed
916  auto baseClause = std::unique_ptr<AstClause>(clause.cloneHead());
917  for (AstLiteral* oldLit : bodyLiterals) {
918  if (currLit != oldLit) {
919  baseClause->addToBody(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(oldLit->clone()));
920  }
921  }
922 
923  for (std::vector<AstLiteral*> body : bodyVersions) {
924  AstClause* replacementClause = baseClause->clone();
925 
926  // Add in the current set of literals replacing the inlined literal
927  // In Case 2, each body contains exactly one literal
928  for (AstLiteral* newLit : body) {
929  replacementClause->addToBody(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(newLit));
930  }
931 
932  versions.push_back(replacementClause);
933  }
934  }
935 
936  // Only replace at most one literal per iteration
937  if (changed) {
938  break;
939  }
940  }
941  }
942 
943  if (!changed) {
944  // Case 3: No inlining changes, so a clone of the original should be returned
945  std::vector<AstClause*> ret;
946  ret.push_back(clause.clone());
947  return ret;
948  } else {
949  // Inlining changes, so return the replacement clauses.
950  return versions;
951  }
952 }
souffle::getInlinedAtom
NullableVector< AstAtom * > getInlinedAtom(AstProgram &program, AstAtom &atom)
Returns a vector of atoms that should replace the given atom after one step of inlining.
Definition: InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp:690
souffle::getInlinedLiteral
NullableVector< std::vector< AstLiteral * > > getInlinedLiteral(AstProgram &, AstLiteral *)
Tries to perform a single step of inlining on the given literal.
Definition: InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp:738

Here is the call graph for this function:

NullableVector< std::vector< AstLiteral * > > souffle::getInlinedLiteral ( AstProgram &  program,
AstLiteral *  lit 
)

Tries to perform a single step of inlining on the given literal.

Returns a pair of nullable vectors (v, w) such that:

  • v is valid if and only if the literal can be directly inlined, whereby it contains the bodies that replace it
  • if v is not valid, then w is valid if and only if the literal cannot be inlined directly, but contains a subargument that can be. In this case, it will contain the versions that will replace it.
  • If both are invalid, then no more inlining can occur on this literal and we are done.

Definition at line 738 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References souffle::AstArgument::clone(), EQ, formNegatedLiterals(), souffle::AstAtom::getAtom(), souffle::AstRelation::getClauses(), getInlinedArgument(), getInlinedAtom(), souffle::AstConstraint::getLHS(), souffle::AstConstraint::getOperator(), souffle::AstProgram::getRelation(), souffle::AstConstraint::getRHS(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::getVector(), inlineBodyLiterals(), souffle::AstRelation::isInline(), and souffle::NullableVector< T >::isValid().

Referenced by getInlinedArgument(), and getInlinedClause().

738  {
739  bool inlined = false;
740  bool changed = false;
741 
742  std::vector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> addedBodyLiterals;
743  std::vector<AstLiteral*> versions;
744 
745  if (AstAtom* atom = dynamic_cast<AstAtom*>(lit)) {
746  // Check if this atom is meant to be inlined
747  AstRelation* rel = program.getRelation(atom->getName());
748 
749  if (rel->isInline()) {
750  // We found an atom in the clause that needs to be inlined!
751  // The clause needs to be replaced
752  inlined = true;
753 
754  // N new clauses should be formed, where N is the number of clauses
755  // associated with the inlined relation
756  for (AstClause* inClause : rel->getClauses()) {
757  // Form the replacement clause
758  std::pair<NullableVector<AstLiteral*>, std::vector<AstConstraint*>> inlineResult =
759  inlineBodyLiterals(atom, inClause);
760  NullableVector<AstLiteral*> replacementBodyLiterals = inlineResult.first;
761  std::vector<AstConstraint*> currConstraints = inlineResult.second;
762 
763  if (!replacementBodyLiterals.isValid()) {
764  // Failed to unify the atoms! We can skip this one...
765  continue;
766  }
767 
768  // Unification successful - the returned vector of literals represents one possible body
769  // replacement We can add in the unification constraints as part of these literals.
770  std::vector<AstLiteral*> bodyResult = replacementBodyLiterals.getVector();
771 
772  for (AstConstraint* cons : currConstraints) {
773  bodyResult.push_back(cons);
774  }
775 
776  addedBodyLiterals.push_back(bodyResult);
777  }
778  } else {
779  // Not meant to be inlined, but a subargument may be
780  NullableVector<AstAtom*> atomVersions = getInlinedAtom(program, *atom);
781  if (atomVersions.isValid()) {
782  // Subnode needs to be inlined, so we have a vector of replacement atoms
783  changed = true;
784  for (AstAtom* newAtom : atomVersions.getVector()) {
785  versions.push_back(newAtom);
786  }
787  }
788  }
789  } else if (AstNegation* neg = dynamic_cast<AstNegation*>(lit)) {
790  // For negations, check the corresponding atom
791  AstAtom* atom = neg->getAtom();
792  NullableVector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>> atomVersions = getInlinedLiteral(program, atom);
793 
794  if (atomVersions.isValid()) {
795  // The atom can be inlined
796  inlined = true;
797 
798  if (atomVersions.getVector().empty()) {
799  // No clauses associated with the atom, so just becomes a true literal
800  std::vector<AstLiteral*> trueBody;
801  trueBody.push_back(new AstConstraint(BinaryConstraintOp::EQ,
802  std::make_unique<AstNumberConstant>(1), std::make_unique<AstNumberConstant>(1)));
803  addedBodyLiterals.push_back(trueBody);
804  } else {
805  // Suppose an atom a(x) is inlined and has the following rules:
806  // - a(x) :- a11(x), a12(x).
807  // - a(x) :- a21(x), a22(x).
808  // Then, a(x) <- (a11(x) ^ a12(x)) v (a21(x) ^ a22(x))
809  // => !a(x) <- (!a11(x) v !a12(x)) ^ (!a21(x) v !a22(x))
810  // => !a(x) <- (!a11(x) ^ !a21(x)) v (!a11(x) ^ !a22(x)) v ...
811  // Essentially, produce every combination (m_1 ^ m_2 ^ ...) where m_i is a
812  // negated literal in the ith rule of a.
813  addedBodyLiterals = formNegatedLiterals(program, atom);
814  }
815  }
816  } else {
817  AstConstraint* constraint = dynamic_cast<AstConstraint*>(lit);
818  NullableVector<AstArgument*> lhsVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, constraint->getLHS());
819  if (lhsVersions.isValid()) {
820  changed = true;
821  for (AstArgument* newLhs : lhsVersions.getVector()) {
822  AstLiteral* newLit =
823  new AstConstraint(constraint->getOperator(), std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newLhs),
824  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(constraint->getRHS()->clone()));
825  versions.push_back(newLit);
826  }
827  } else {
828  NullableVector<AstArgument*> rhsVersions = getInlinedArgument(program, constraint->getRHS());
829  if (rhsVersions.isValid()) {
830  changed = true;
831  for (AstArgument* newRhs : rhsVersions.getVector()) {
832  AstLiteral* newLit = new AstConstraint(constraint->getOperator(),
833  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(constraint->getLHS()->clone()),
834  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(newRhs));
835  versions.push_back(newLit);
836  }
837  }
838  }
839  }
840 
841  if (changed) {
842  // Not inlined directly but found replacement literals
843  // Rewrite these as single-literal bodies
844  for (AstLiteral* version : versions) {
845  std::vector<AstLiteral*> newBody;
846  newBody.push_back(version);
847  addedBodyLiterals.push_back(newBody);
848  }
849  inlined = true;
850  }
851 
852  if (inlined) {
853  return NullableVector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>>(addedBodyLiterals);
854  } else {
855  return NullableVector<std::vector<AstLiteral*>>();
856  }
857 }

Forms the bodies that will replace the negation of a given inlined atom.

TypeSet souffle::getLeastCommonSupertypes ( const Type &  a,
const Type &  b 
)

Computes the least common super types of the two given types.

Definition at line 410 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References any_of(), souffle::TypeEnvironment::getAllTypes(), souffle::Type::getTypeEnvironment(), souffle::TypeSet::insert(), isSubtypeOf(), and souffle::TypeEnvironment::isType().

Referenced by getLeastCommonSupertypes().

410  {
411  // make sure they are in the same type environment
412  assert(a.getTypeEnvironment().isType(a) && a.getTypeEnvironment().isType(b));
413 
414  // if they are equal it is easy
415  if (a == b) {
416  return TypeSet(a);
417  }
418 
419  // equally simple - check whether one is a sub-type of the other
420  if (isSubtypeOf(a, b)) {
421  return TypeSet(b);
422  }
423  if (isSubtypeOf(b, a)) {
424  return TypeSet(a);
425  }
426 
427  // harder: no obvious relation => hard way
428  TypeSet superTypes;
429  TypeSet all = a.getTypeEnvironment().getAllTypes();
430  for (const Type& cur : all) {
431  if (isSubtypeOf(a, cur) && isSubtypeOf(b, cur)) {
432  superTypes.insert(cur);
433  }
434  }
435 
436  // filter out non-least super types
437  TypeSet res;
438  for (const Type& cur : superTypes) {
439  bool least = !any_of(superTypes, [&](const Type& t) { return t != cur && isSubtypeOf(t, cur); });
440  if (least) {
441  res.insert(cur);
442  }
443  }
444 
445  return res;
446 }

TypeSet souffle::getLeastCommonSupertypes ( const TypeSet &  set)

Computes the least common super types of all the types in the given set.

Definition at line 448 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References souffle::TypeSet::begin(), souffle::TypeSet::empty(), souffle::TypeSet::end(), getLeastCommonSupertypes(), souffle::TypeSet::insert(), and souffle::TypeSet::isAll().

448  {
449  // handle the empty set
450  if (set.empty()) {
451  return set;
452  }
453 
454  // handle the all set => empty set (since no common super-type)
455  if (set.isAll()) {
456  return TypeSet();
457  }
458 
459  TypeSet res;
460  auto it = set.begin();
461  res.insert(*it);
462  ++it;
463 
464  // refine sub-set step by step
465  for (; it != set.end(); ++it) {
466  TypeSet tmp;
467  for (const Type& cur : res) {
468  tmp.insert(getLeastCommonSupertypes(cur, *it));
469  }
470  res = tmp;
471  }
472 
473  // done
474  return res;
475 }

528  {
529  int maxBound = -1;
530  int maxIndex = 0;
531  bool maxIsEDB = false; // checks if current max index is an EDB predicate
532 
533  for (size_t i = 0; i < atoms.size(); i++) {
534  AstAtom* currAtom = atoms[i];
535  if (currAtom == nullptr) {
536  // already done - move on
537  continue;
538  }
539 
540  int numBound = 0;
541  for (AstArgument* arg : currAtom->getArguments()) {
542  if (isBoundArgument(arg, boundArgs, compositeBindings)) {
543  numBound++;
544  }
545  }
546 
547  if (numBound > maxBound) {
548  maxBound = numBound;
549  maxIndex = i;
550  maxIsEDB = contains(edb, currAtom->getName());
551  } else if (!maxIsEDB && numBound == maxBound && contains(edb, currAtom->getName())) {
552  // prioritise EDB predicates
553  maxIsEDB = true;
554  maxIndex = i;
555  }
556  }
557 
558  return maxIndex;
559 }

int souffle::getNextAtomMaxRatioSIPS ( std::vector< AstAtom * > &  atoms,
std::set< std::string >  boundArgs,
std::set< AstRelationIdentifier >  edb,
BindingStore &  compositeBindings 
)

Definition at line 562 of file MagicSet.cpp.

References souffle::AstAtom::getArguments(), souffle::AstAtom::getArity(), and isBoundArgument().

563  {
564  double maxRatio = -1;
565  int maxIndex = 0;
566 
567  for (size_t i = 0; i < atoms.size(); i++) {
568  AstAtom* currAtom = atoms[i];
569  if (currAtom == nullptr) {
570  // already done - move on
571  continue;
572  }
573 
574  int numArguments = currAtom->getArity();
575  if (numArguments == 0) {
576  return i; // no arguments!
577  }
578 
579  int numBound = 0;
580  for (AstArgument* arg : currAtom->getArguments()) {
581  if (isBoundArgument(arg, boundArgs, compositeBindings)) {
582  numBound++;
583  }
584  }
585 
586  double currRatio = numBound * 1.0 / numArguments;
587 
588  if (currRatio == 1) {
589  return i; // all bound, not going to get better than this
590  }
591 
592  if (currRatio > maxRatio) {
593  maxRatio = currRatio;
594  maxIndex = i;
595  }
596  }
597 
598  return maxIndex;
599 }

References contains(), souffle::AstAtom::getName(), and hasBoundArgument().

487  {
488  // find the first available atom with at least one bound argument
489  int firstedb = -1;
490  int firstidb = -1;
491  for (size_t i = 0; i < atoms.size(); i++) {
492  AstAtom* currAtom = atoms[i];
493  if (currAtom == nullptr) {
494  // already done - move on
495  continue;
496  }
497 
498  AstRelationIdentifier atomName = currAtom->getName();
499 
500  // check if this is the first edb or idb atom met
501  if (contains(edb, atomName)) {
502  if (firstedb < 0) {
503  firstedb = i;
504  }
505  } else if (firstidb < 0) {
506  firstidb = i;
507  }
508 
509  // if it has at least one bound argument, then adorn this atom next
510  if (hasBoundArgument(currAtom, boundArgs, compositeBindings)) {
511  return i;
512  }
513  }
514 
515  // all unadorned body atoms only have free arguments
516  // choose the first edb remaining if available
517  if (firstedb >= 0) {
518  return firstedb;
519  } else {
520  return firstidb;
521  }
522 }

std::string souffle::getTypeQualifier ( const Type &  type)

Returns full type qualifier for a given type.

Definition at line 256 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References ASSERT, souffle::UnionType::getElementTypes(), souffle::RecordType::getFields(), souffle::Type::getName(), isNumberType(), isRecordType(), isSymbolType(), seen, and toString().

256  {
257  struct visitor : public VisitOnceTypeVisitor<std::string> {
258  std::string visitUnionType(const UnionType& type) const override {
259  std::string str = visitType(type);
260  str += "[";
261  bool first = true;
262  for (auto unionType : type.getElementTypes()) {
263  if (first) {
264  first = false;
265  } else {
266  str += ",";
267  }
268  str += visit(*unionType);
269  }
270  str += "]";
271  return str;
272  }
273 
274  std::string visitRecordType(const RecordType& type) const override {
275  std::string str = visitType(type);
276  str += "{";
277  bool first = true;
278  for (auto field : type.getFields()) {
279  if (first) {
280  first = false;
281  } else {
282  str += ",";
283  }
284  str += field.name;
285  str += "#";
286  str += visit(field.type);
287  }
288  str += "}";
289  return str;
290  }
291 
292  std::string visitType(const Type& type) const override {
293  std::string str;
294  if (isNumberType(type)) {
295  str = "i:" + toString(type.getName());
296  } else if (isSymbolType(type)) {
297  str = "s:" + toString(type.getName());
298  } else if (isRecordType(type)) {
299  str = "r:" + toString(type.getName());
300  } else {
301  ASSERT(false && "unknown type class");
302  }
303  seen[&type] = str;
304  return str;
305  }
306  };
307 
308  return visitor().visit(type);
309 }

118  if (symbol == "atanh") return UnaryOp::ATANH;
119  if (symbol == "tan") return UnaryOp::TAN;
120  if (symbol == "exp") return UnaryOp::EXP;
121  std::cout << "Unrecognised operator: " << symbol << "\n";
122  assert(false && "Unsupported Operator!");
123  return UnaryOp::__UNDEFINED__;
124 }

std::pair<NullableVector<AstLiteral*>, std::vector<AstConstraint*> > souffle::inlineBodyLiterals ( AstAtom *  atom,
AstClause *  atomInlineClause 
)

Inlines the given atom based on a given clause.

Returns the vector of replacement literals and the necessary constraints. If unification is unsuccessful, the vector of literals is marked as invalid.

Definition at line 238 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References souffle::AstClause::apply(), souffle::AstClause::clone(), constraints, EQ, souffle::AstClause::getBodyLiterals(), souffle::AstClause::getHead(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::getVector(), souffle::NullableVector< T >::isValid(), node, and unifyAtoms().

Referenced by formNegatedLiterals(), and getInlinedLiteral().

239  {
240  bool changed = false;
241  std::vector<AstLiteral*> addedLits;
242  std::vector<AstConstraint*> constraints;
243 
244  // Rename the variables in the inlined clause to avoid conflicts when unifying multiple atoms
245  // - particularly when an inlined relation appears twice in a clause.
246  static int inlineCount = 0;
247 
248  // Make a temporary clone so we can rename variables without fear
249  AstClause* atomClause = atomInlineClause->clone();
250 
251  struct VariableRenamer : public AstNodeMapper {
252  int varnum;
253  VariableRenamer(int varnum) : varnum(varnum) {}
254  std::unique_ptr<AstNode> operator()(std::unique_ptr<AstNode> node) const override {
255  if (AstVariable* var = dynamic_cast<AstVariable*>(node.get())) {
256  // Rename the variable
257  auto newVar = std::unique_ptr<AstVariable>(var->clone());
258  std::stringstream newName;
259  newName << "<inlined_" << var->getName() << "_" << varnum << ">";
260  newVar->setName(newName.str());
261  return std::move(newVar);
262  }
263  node->apply(*this);
264  return node;
265  }
266  };
267 
268  VariableRenamer update(inlineCount);
269  atomClause->apply(update);
270 
271  inlineCount++;
272 
273  // Get the constraints needed to unify the two atoms
274  NullableVector<std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*>> res = unifyAtoms(atomClause->getHead(), atom);
275  if (res.isValid()) {
276  changed = true;
277  for (std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*> pair : res.getVector()) {
278  constraints.push_back(new AstConstraint(BinaryConstraintOp::EQ,
279  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(pair.first->clone()),
280  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(pair.second->clone())));
281  }
282 
283  // Add in the body of the current clause of the inlined atom
284  for (AstLiteral* lit : atomClause->getBodyLiterals()) {
285  addedLits.push_back(lit->clone());
286  }
287  }
288 
289  delete atomClause;
290 
291  if (changed) {
292  return std::make_pair(NullableVector<AstLiteral*>(addedLits), constraints);
293  } else {
294  return std::make_pair(NullableVector<AstLiteral*>(), constraints);
295  }
296 }

bool souffle::isRecursiveType ( const Type &  type)

Determines whether the given type is a recursive type.

Definition at line 335 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References any_of(), souffle::UnionType::getElementTypes(), and souffle::RecordType::getFields().

335  {
336  struct visitor : public VisitOnceTypeVisitor<bool> {
337  const Type& trg;
338  visitor(const Type& trg) : trg(trg) {}
339  bool visit(const Type& type) const override {
340  if (trg == type) {
341  return true;
342  }
343  return VisitOnceTypeVisitor<bool>::visit(type);
344  }
345  bool visitUnionType(const UnionType& type) const override {
346  auto reachesTrg = [&](const Type* cur) { return this->visit(*cur); };
347  return any_of(type.getElementTypes(), reachesTrg);
348  }
349  bool visitRecordType(const RecordType& type) const override {
350  auto reachesTrg = [&](const RecordType::Field& cur) { return this->visit(cur.type); };
351  return any_of(type.getFields(), reachesTrg);
352  }
353  };
354 
355  // record types are recursive if they contain themselves
356  if (const RecordType* r = dynamic_cast<const RecordType*>(&type)) {
357  auto reachesOrigin = visitor(type);
358  return any_of(r->getFields(),
359  [&](const RecordType::Field& field) -> bool { return reachesOrigin(field.type); });
360  }
361 
362  return false;
363 }

bool souffle::isSubtypeOf ( const Type &  a,

)

Determines whether type a is a subtype of type b.

Definition at line 365 of file TypeSystem.cpp.

References souffle::Type::getTypeEnvironment(), isNumberType(), and isSymbolType().

Referenced by souffle::TypeAnalysis::analyseTypes(), areSubtypesOf(), getGreatestCommonSubtypes(), and getLeastCommonSupertypes().

365  {
366  // make sure they are both in the same environment
367  auto& environment = a.getTypeEnvironment();
368  assert(environment.isType(a) && environment.isType(b));
369 
370  // first check - a type is a sub-type of itself
371  if (a == b) {
372  return true;
373  }
374 
375  // check for predefined types
376  if (b == environment.getNumberType()) {
377  return isNumberType(a);
378  }
379  if (b == environment.getSymbolType()) {
380  return isSymbolType(a);
381  }
382 
383  // check primitive type chains
384  if (isA<PrimitiveType>(a)) {
385  if (isSubtypeOf(as<PrimitiveType>(a).getBaseType(), b)) {
386  return true;
387  }
388  }
389 
390  // next - if b is a union type
391  if (isUnion(b)) {
392  return isSubType(a, as<UnionType>(b));
393  }
394 
395  // done
396  return false;
397 }

int souffle::main ( int  argc,

)

Definition at line 119 of file main.cpp.

Referenced by main().

119  {
120  /* Time taking for overall runtime */
121  auto souffle_start = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
122 
123  /* have all to do with command line arguments in its own scope, as these are accessible through the global
124  * configuration only */
125  {
126  Global::config().processArgs(argc, argv,
127  []() {
128  std::stringstream header;
129  header << "============================================================================"
130  << std::endl;
131  header << "souffle -- A datalog engine." << std::endl;
132  header << "Usage: souffle [OPTION] FILE." << std::endl;
133  header << "----------------------------------------------------------------------------"
134  << std::endl;
135  header << "Options:" << std::endl;
136  return header.str();
137  }(),
138  []() {
139  std::stringstream footer;
140  footer << "----------------------------------------------------------------------------"
141  << std::endl;
142  footer << "Version: " << PACKAGE_VERSION << "" << std::endl;
143  footer << "----------------------------------------------------------------------------"
144  << std::endl;
145  footer << "Copyright (c) 2016-18 The Souffle Developers." << std::endl;
146  footer << "Copyright (c) 2013-16 Oracle and/or its affiliates." << std::endl;
147  footer << "All rights reserved." << std::endl;
148  footer << "============================================================================"
149  << std::endl;
150  return footer.str();
151  }(),
152  // command line options, the environment will be filled with the arguments passed to them, or
153  // the empty string if they take none
154  []() {
155  MainOption opts[] = {
156  {"", 0, "", "", false,
157  ""}, // main option, the datalog program itself, key is always empty
158  {"fact-dir", 'F', "DIR", ".", false, "Specify directory for fact files."},
159  {"include-dir", 'I', "DIR", ".", true, "Specify directory for include files."},
160  {"output-dir", 'D', "DIR", ".", false,
161  "Specify directory for output files (if <DIR> is -, stdout is used)."},
162  {"jobs", 'j', "N", "1", false,
163  "Run interpreter/compiler in parallel using N threads, N=auto for system "
164  "default."},
165  {"compile", 'c', "", "", false,
166  "Generate C++ source code, compile to a binary executable, then run this "
167  "executable."},
168  {"auto-schedule", 'a', "", "", false,
169  "Switch on automated clause scheduling for compiler."},
170  {"generate", 'g', "FILE", "", false,
171  "Generate C++ source code for the given Datalog program and write it to "
172  "<FILE>."},
173  {"no-warn", 'w', "", "", false, "Disable warnings."},
174  {"magic-transform", 'm', "RELATIONS", "", false,
175  "Enable magic set transformation changes on the given relations, use '*' "
176  "for all."},
177  {"dl-program", 'o', "FILE", "", false,
178  "Generate C++ source code, written to <FILE>, and compile this to a "
179  "binary executable (without executing it)."},
180  {"profile", 'p', "FILE", "", false,
181  "Enable profiling, and write profile data to <FILE>."},
182  {"bddbddb", 'b', "FILE", "", false, "Convert input into bddbddb file format."},
183  {"debug-report", 'r', "FILE", "", false, "Write HTML debug report to <FILE>."},
184 #ifdef USE_PROVENANCE
185  {"provenance", 't', "EXPLAIN", "", false,
186  "Enable provenance information via guided SLD."},
187 #endif
188  {"data-structure", 'd', "type", "", false,
189  "Specify data structure (brie/btree/eqrel/hashmap)."},
190  {"verbose", 'v', "", "", false, "Verbose output."},
191  {"help", 'h', "", "", false, "Display this help message."}};
192  return std::vector<MainOption>(std::begin(opts), std::end(opts));
193  }());
194 
195  // ------ command line arguments -------------
196 
197  /* for the help option, if given simply print the help text then exit */
198  if (!Global::config().has("") || Global::config().has("help")) {
199  std::cerr << Global::config().help();
200  return 0;
201  }
202 
203  /* check that datalog program exists */
204  if (!existFile(Global::config().get(""))) {
205  ERROR("cannot open file " + std::string(Global::config().get("")));
206  }
207 
208  /* for the jobs option, to determine the number of threads used */
209  if (Global::config().has("jobs")) {
210  if (isNumber(Global::config().get("jobs").c_str())) {
211  if (std::stoi(Global::config().get("jobs")) < 1) {
212  ERROR("Number of jobs in the -j/--jobs options must be greater than zero!");
213  }
214  } else {
215  if (!Global::config().has("jobs", "auto")) {
216  ERROR("Wrong parameter " + Global::config().get("jobs") + " for option -j/--jobs!");
217  }
218  Global::config().set("jobs", "0");
219  }
220  } else {
221  ERROR("Wrong parameter " + Global::config().get("jobs") + " for option -j/--jobs!");
222  }
223 
224  /* if an output directory is given, check it exists */
225  if (Global::config().has("output-dir") && !Global::config().has("output-dir", "-") &&
226  !existDir(Global::config().get("output-dir")) &&
227  !(Global::config().has("generate") ||
228  (Global::config().has("dl-program") && !Global::config().has("compile")))) {
229  ERROR("output directory " + Global::config().get("output-dir") + " does not exists");
230  }
231 
232  /* ensure that if auto-scheduling is enabled an output file is given */
233  if (Global::config().has("auto-schedule") && !Global::config().has("dl-program")) {
234  ERROR("no executable is specified for auto-scheduling (option -o <FILE>)");
235  }
236 
237  /* collect all input directories for the c pre-processor */
238  if (Global::config().has("include-dir")) {
239  std::string currentInclude = "";
240  std::string allIncludes = "";
241  for (const char& ch : Global::config().get("include-dir")) {
242  if (ch == ' ') {
243  if (!existDir(currentInclude)) {
244  ERROR("include directory " + currentInclude + " does not exists");
245  } else {
246  allIncludes += " -I";
247  allIncludes += currentInclude;
248  currentInclude = "";
249  }
250  } else {
251  currentInclude += ch;
252  }
253  }
254  allIncludes += " -I" + currentInclude;
255  Global::config().set("include-dir", allIncludes);
256  }
257 
258  /* turn on compilation of executables */
259  if (Global::config().has("dl-program")) {
260  Global::config().set("compile");
261  }
262 
263  /* disable provenance with multithreading */
264  if (Global::config().has("provenance")) {
265  if (Global::config().has("jobs")) {
266  if (Global::config().get("jobs") != "1") {
267  ERROR("provenance cannot be enabled with multiple jobs.");
268  }
269  }
270  }
271  }
272 
273  // ------ start souffle -------------
274 
275  std::string souffleExecutable = which(argv[0]);
276 
277  if (souffleExecutable.empty()) {
278  ERROR("failed to determine souffle executable path");
279  }
280 
281  /* Create the pipe to establish a communication between cpp and souffle */
282  std::string cmd = ::which("mcpp");
283 
284  if (!isExecutable(cmd)) {
285  ERROR("failed to locate mcpp pre-processor");
286  }
287 
288  cmd += " -W0 " + Global::config().get("include-dir") + " " + Global::config().get("");
289  FILE* in = popen(cmd.c_str(), "r");
290 
291  /* Time taking for parsing */
292  auto parser_start = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
293 
294  // ------- parse program -------------
295 
296  // parse file
297  SymbolTable symTab;
298  ErrorReport errReport(Global::config().has("no-warn"));
299  DebugReport debugReport;
300  std::unique_ptr<AstTranslationUnit> astTranslationUnit =
301  ParserDriver::parseTranslationUnit("<stdin>", in, symTab, errReport, debugReport);
302 
303  // close input pipe
304  int preprocessor_status = pclose(in);
305  if (preprocessor_status == -1) {
306  perror(nullptr);
307  ERROR("failed to close pre-processor pipe");
308  }
309 
310  /* Report run-time of the parser if verbose flag is set */
311  if (Global::config().has("verbose")) {
312  auto parser_end = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
313  std::cout << "Parse Time: " << std::chrono::duration<double>(parser_end - parser_start).count()
314  << "sec\n";
315  }
316 
317  // ------- check for parse errors -------------
318  if (astTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumErrors() != 0) {
319  std::cerr << astTranslationUnit->getErrorReport();
320  std::cerr << std::to_string(astTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumErrors()) +
321  " errors generated, evaluation aborted"
322  << std::endl;
323  exit(1);
324  }
325 
326  // ------- rewriting / optimizations -------------
327 
328  /* set up additional global options based on pragma declaratives */
329  (std::make_unique<AstPragmaChecker>())->apply(*astTranslationUnit);
330  std::vector<std::unique_ptr<AstTransformer>> astTransforms;
331 
332  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<AstComponentChecker>());
333  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<ComponentInstantiationTransformer>());
334  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<UniqueAggregationVariablesTransformer>());
335  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<AstSemanticChecker>());
336  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<InlineRelationsTransformer>());
337  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<ReduceExistentialsTransformer>());
338  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<ExtractDisconnectedLiteralsTransformer>());
339  if (Global::config().get("bddbddb").empty()) {
340  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<ResolveAliasesTransformer>());
341  }
342  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<RemoveRelationCopiesTransformer>());
343  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<MaterializeAggregationQueriesTransformer>());
344  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<RemoveEmptyRelationsTransformer>());
345  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<RemoveRedundantRelationsTransformer>());
346 
347  if (Global::config().has("magic-transform")) {
348  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<NormaliseConstraintsTransformer>());
349  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<MagicSetTransformer>());
350 
351  if (Global::config().get("bddbddb").empty()) {
352  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<ResolveAliasesTransformer>());
353  }
354  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<RemoveRelationCopiesTransformer>());
355  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<RemoveEmptyRelationsTransformer>());
356  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<RemoveRedundantRelationsTransformer>());
357  }
358 
359  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<AstExecutionPlanChecker>());
360 
361  if (Global::config().has("auto-schedule")) {
362  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<AutoScheduleTransformer>());
363  }
364 #ifdef USE_PROVENANCE
365  // Add provenance information by transforming to records
366  if (Global::config().has("provenance")) {
367  astTransforms.push_back(std::make_unique<ProvenanceTransformer>());
368  }
369 #endif
370 
371  // Enable debug reports for the AST astTransforms
372  if (!Global::config().get("debug-report").empty()) {
373  auto parser_end = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
374  std::string runtimeStr =
375  "(" + std::to_string(std::chrono::duration<double>(parser_end - parser_start).count()) + "s)";
376  DebugReporter::generateDebugReport(*astTranslationUnit, "Parsing", "After Parsing " + runtimeStr);
377  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < astTransforms.size(); i++) {
378  astTransforms[i] =
379  std::unique_ptr<AstTransformer>(new DebugReporter(std::move(astTransforms[i])));
380  }
381  }
382 
383  for (const auto& transform : astTransforms) {
384  transform->apply(*astTranslationUnit);
385 
386  /* Abort evaluation of the program if errors were encountered */
387  if (astTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumErrors() != 0) {
388  std::cerr << astTranslationUnit->getErrorReport();
389  std::cerr << std::to_string(astTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumErrors()) +
390  " errors generated, evaluation aborted"
391  << std::endl;
392  exit(1);
393  }
394  }
395 
396  // ------- (optional) conversions -------------
397 
398  // conduct the bddbddb file export
399  if (!Global::config().get("bddbddb").empty()) {
400  try {
401  if (Global::config().get("bddbddb") == "-") {
402  // use STD-OUT
403  toBddbddb(std::cout, *astTranslationUnit);
404  } else {
405  // create an output file
406  std::ofstream out(Global::config().get("bddbddb").c_str());
407  toBddbddb(out, *astTranslationUnit);
408  }
409  } catch (const UnsupportedConstructException& uce) {
410  ERROR("failed to convert input specification into bddbddb syntax because " +
411  std::string(uce.what()));
412  }
413  return 0;
414  }
415 
416  // ------- execution -------------
417 
418  auto ram_start = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
419 
420  /* translate AST to RAM */
421  std::unique_ptr<RamTranslationUnit> ramTranslationUnit =
422  AstTranslator().translateUnit(*astTranslationUnit);
423 
424  std::vector<std::unique_ptr<RamTransformer>> ramTransforms;
425  ramTransforms.push_back(std::unique_ptr<RamTransformer>(new RamSemanticChecker()));
426 
427  for (const auto& transform : ramTransforms) {
428  transform->apply(*ramTranslationUnit);
429 
430  /* Abort evaluation of the program if errors were encountered */
431  if (ramTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumErrors() != 0) {
432  std::cerr << ramTranslationUnit->getErrorReport();
433  std::cerr << std::to_string(ramTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumErrors()) +
434  " errors generated, evaluation aborted"
435  << std::endl;
436  exit(1);
437  }
438  }
439  if (ramTranslationUnit->getErrorReport().getNumIssues() != 0) {
440  std::cerr << ramTranslationUnit->getErrorReport();
441  }
442 
443  if (!Global::config().get("debug-report").empty()) {
444  if (ramTranslationUnit->getProgram()) {
445  auto ram_end = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
446  std::string runtimeStr =
447  "(" + std::to_string(std::chrono::duration<double>(ram_end - ram_start).count()) + "s)";
448  std::stringstream ramProgStr;
449  ramProgStr << *ramTranslationUnit->getProgram();
450  astTranslationUnit->getDebugReport().addSection(DebugReporter::getCodeSection(
451  "ram-program", "RAM Program " + runtimeStr, ramProgStr.str()));
452  }
453 
454  if (!ramTranslationUnit->getDebugReport().empty()) {
455  std::ofstream debugReportStream(Global::config().get("debug-report"));
456  debugReportStream << ramTranslationUnit->getDebugReport();
457  }
458  }
459 
460  if (!ramTranslationUnit->getProgram()->getMain()) {
461  return 0;
462  };
463 
464  if (!Global::config().has("compile") && !Global::config().has("dl-program") &&
465  !Global::config().has("generate")) {
466  // ------- interpreter -------------
467 
468  // configure interpreter
469  std::unique_ptr<Interpreter> interpreter = (Global::config().has("auto-schedule"))
470  ? std::make_unique<Interpreter>(ScheduledExecution)
471  : std::make_unique<Interpreter>(DirectExecution);
472  std::unique_ptr<InterpreterEnvironment> env = interpreter->execute(*ramTranslationUnit);
473 
474 #ifdef USE_PROVENANCE
475  // only run explain interface if interpreted
476  if (Global::config().has("provenance") && env != nullptr) {
477  // construct SouffleProgram from env
478  InterpreterProgInterface interface(*ramTranslationUnit, *interpreter, *env);
479 
480  if (Global::config().get("provenance") == "1") {
481  explain(interface, true, false);
482  } else if (Global::config().get("provenance") == "2") {
483  explain(interface, true, true);
484  }
485  }
486 #endif
487 
488  } else {
489  // ------- compiler -------------
490 
491  std::string compileCmd = ::findTool("souffle-compile", souffleExecutable, ".");
492  /* Fail if a souffle-compile executable is not found */
493  if (!isExecutable(compileCmd)) {
494  ERROR("failed to locate souffle-compile");
495  }
496  compileCmd += " ";
497 
498  std::unique_ptr<Synthesiser> synthesiser = std::make_unique<Synthesiser>();
499 
500  // configure compiler
501  if (Global::config().has("verbose")) {
502  synthesiser->setReportTarget(std::cout);
503  }
504  try {
505  // Find the base filename for code generation and execution
506  std::string baseFilename;
507  if (Global::config().has("dl-program")) {
508  baseFilename = Global::config().get("dl-program");
509  } else if (Global::config().has("generate")) {
510  baseFilename = Global::config().get("generate");
511  // trim .cpp extension if it exists
512  if (baseFilename.size() >= 4 && baseFilename.substr(baseFilename.size() - 4) == ".cpp") {
513  baseFilename = baseFilename.substr(0, baseFilename.size() - 4);
514  }
515  } else {
516  baseFilename = tempFile();
517  }
518  if (baseName(baseFilename) == "/" || baseName(baseFilename) == ".") {
519  baseFilename = tempFile();
520  }
521 
522  std::string baseIdentifier = identifier(simpleName(baseFilename));
523  std::string sourceFilename = baseFilename + ".cpp";
524 
525  std::ofstream os(sourceFilename);
526  synthesiser->generateCode(*ramTranslationUnit, os, baseIdentifier);
527  os.close();
528 
529  if (Global::config().has("compile")) {
530  compileToBinary(compileCmd, sourceFilename);
531  // run compiled C++ program if requested.
532  if (!Global::config().has("dl-program")) {
533  executeBinary(baseFilename);
534  }
535  }
536  } catch (std::exception& e) {
537  std::cerr << e.what() << std::endl;
538  }
539  }
540 
541  /* Report overall run-time in verbose mode */
542  if (Global::config().has("verbose")) {
543  auto souffle_end = std::chrono::high_resolution_clock::now();
544  std::cout << "Total Time: " << std::chrono::duration<double>(souffle_end - souffle_start).count()
545  << "sec\n";
546  }
547 
548  return 0;
549 }

void souffle::nameInlinedUnderscores ( AstProgram &  program)

Removes all underscores in all atoms of inlined relations.

Definition at line 81 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References souffle::AstProgram::apply(), souffle::AstProgram::getRelations(), node, and replaceUnderscores().

Referenced by souffle::InlineRelationsTransformer::transform().

81  {
82  struct M : public AstNodeMapper {
83  const std::set<AstRelationIdentifier> inlinedRelations;
84  bool replaceUnderscores;
85 
86  M(std::set<AstRelationIdentifier> inlinedRelations, bool replaceUnderscores)
87  : inlinedRelations(inlinedRelations), replaceUnderscores(replaceUnderscores) {}
88 
89  std::unique_ptr<AstNode> operator()(std::unique_ptr<AstNode> node) const override {
90  static int underscoreCount = 0;
91 
92  if (!replaceUnderscores) {
93  // Check if we should start replacing underscores for this node's subnodes
94  if (AstAtom* atom = dynamic_cast<AstAtom*>(node.get())) {
95  if (inlinedRelations.find(atom->getName()) != inlinedRelations.end()) {
96  // Atom associated with an inlined relation, so replace the underscores
97  // in all of its subnodes with named variables.
98  M replace(inlinedRelations, true);
99  node->apply(replace);
100  return node;
101  }
102  }
103  } else if (dynamic_cast<AstUnnamedVariable*>(node.get())) {
104  // Give a unique name to the underscored variable
105  // TODO (azreika): need a more consistent way of handling internally generated variables in
106  // general
107  std::stringstream newVarName;
108  newVarName << "<underscore_" << underscoreCount++ << ">";
109  return std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVarName.str());
110  }
111 
112  node->apply(*this);
113  return node;
114  }
115  };
116

118  std::set<AstRelationIdentifier> inlinedRelations;

120  if (rel->isInline()) {
121  inlinedRelations.insert(rel->getName());
122  }
123  }
124

127  program.apply(update);
128 }

template<typename Container , typename UnaryPredicate >
bool souffle::none_of ( const Container &  c,

)

A generic test checking whether all elements within a container satisfy a certain predicate.

Parameters

pthe predicate
Returns
true if for all elements x in c the predicate p(x) is true, false otherwise; for empty containers the result is always true
