void souffle::normaliseInlinedHeads ( AstProgram &  program)

Replace constants in the head of inlined clauses with (constrained) variables.

Definition at line 31 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References EQ, souffle::AstProgram::getRelations(), and souffle::AstProgram::removeClause().

Referenced by souffle::InlineRelationsTransformer::transform().

31  {
32  static int newVarCount = 0;
33 
34  // Go through the clauses of all inlined relations
35  for (AstRelation* rel : program.getRelations()) {
36  if (!rel->isInline()) {
37  break;
38  }
39 
40  for (AstClause* clause : rel->getClauses()) {
41  // Set up the new clause with an empty body and no arguments in the head
42  auto newClause = std::make_unique<AstClause>();
43  newClause->setSrcLoc(clause->getSrcLoc());
44  auto clauseHead = std::make_unique<AstAtom>(clause->getHead()->getName());
45 
46  // Add in everything in the original body
47  for (AstLiteral* lit : clause->getBodyLiterals()) {
48  newClause->addToBody(std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(lit->clone()));
49  }
50 
51  // Set up the head arguments in the new clause
52  for (AstArgument* arg : clause->getHead()->getArguments()) {
53  if (AstConstant* constant = dynamic_cast<AstConstant*>(arg)) {
54  // Found a constant in the head, so replace it with a variable
55  std::stringstream newVar;
56  newVar << "<new_var_" << newVarCount++ << ">";
57  clauseHead->addArgument(std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVar.str()));
58 
59  // Add a body constraint to set the variable's value to be the original constant
60  newClause->addToBody(std::make_unique<AstConstraint>(BinaryConstraintOp::EQ,
61  std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVar.str()),
62  std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(constant->clone())));
63  } else {
64  // Already a variable
65  clauseHead->addArgument(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(arg->clone()));
66  }
67  }
68 
69  newClause->setHead(std::move(clauseHead));
70 
71  // Replace the old clause with this one
72  rel->addClause(std::move(newClause));
73  program.removeClause(clause);
74  }
75  }
76 }

bool souffle::reduceSubstitution ( std::vector< std::pair< AstArgument *, AstArgument * >> &  sub)

Reduces a vector of substitutions.

Returns false only if matched argument pairs are found to be incompatible.

Definition at line 150 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References lhs, rhs, and sub().

Referenced by unifyAtoms().

150  {
151  // Type-Checking functions
152  auto isConstant = [&](AstArgument* arg) { return (dynamic_cast<AstConstant*>(arg)); };
153  auto isRecord = [&](AstArgument* arg) { return (dynamic_cast<AstRecordInit*>(arg)); };
154 
155  // Keep trying to reduce the substitutions until we reach a fixed point.
156  // Note that at this point no underscores ('_') or counters ('$') should appear.
157  bool done = false;
158  while (!done) {
159  done = true;
160 
161  // Try reducing each pair by one step
162  for (size_t i = 0; i < sub.size(); i++) {
163  auto currPair = sub[i];
164  AstArgument* lhs = currPair.first;
165  AstArgument* rhs = currPair.second;
166 
167  // Start trying to reduce the substitution
168  // Note: Can probably go further with this substitution reduction
169  if (*lhs == *rhs) {
170  // Get rid of redundant `x = x`
171  sub.erase(sub.begin() + i);
172  done = false;
173  } else if (isConstant(lhs) && isConstant(rhs)) {
174  // Both are constants but not equal (prev case => !=)
175  // Failed to unify!
176  return false;
177  } else if (isRecord(lhs) && isRecord(rhs)) {
178  // Note: we will not deal with the case where only one side is
179  // a record and the other is a variable, as variables can be records
180  // on a deeper level.
181  std::vector<AstArgument*> lhsArgs = static_cast<AstRecordInit*>(lhs)->getArguments();
182  std::vector<AstArgument*> rhsArgs = static_cast<AstRecordInit*>(rhs)->getArguments();
183 
184  if (lhsArgs.size() != rhsArgs.size()) {
185  // Records of unequal size can't be equated
186  return false;
187  }
188 
189  // Equate all corresponding arguments
190  for (size_t i = 0; i < lhsArgs.size(); i++) {
191  sub.push_back(std::make_pair(lhsArgs[i], rhsArgs[i]));
192  }
193 
194  // Get rid of the record equality
195  sub.erase(sub.begin() + i);
196  done = false;
197  } else if ((isRecord(lhs) && isConstant(rhs)) || (isConstant(lhs) && isRecord(rhs))) {
198  // A record =/= a constant
199  return false;
200  }
201  }
202  }
203 
204  return true;
205 }

std::vector<unsigned int> souffle::reorderOrdering ( std::vector< unsigned int >  order)

Definition at line 426 of file MagicSet.cpp.

Referenced by souffle::MagicSetTransformer::transform().

426  {
427  // when the adornment is computed, the atoms are numbered based on
428  // which was chosen by the SIPS first - this is the 'order' vector.
429  // want to reorder clause atoms so that the atom labelled 0 is first, and so on.
430  // i.e. order[i] denotes where labels[i] should move
431  // e.g.: [a, b, c] with label [1, 2, 0] should become [c, a, b]
432 
433  // the atom reordering function for clauses, however, moves it as follows:
434  // [a, b, c] with label [1, 2, 0] becomes [b, c, a]
435  // i.e. labels[i] goes to the position of i in the order vector
436 
437  // this function reorders the ordering scheme to match the second type
438  std::vector<unsigned int> neworder(order.size());
439  for (size_t i = 0; i < order.size(); i++) {
440  // this took embarrassingly long to figure out
441  neworder[order[i]] = i;
442  }
443  return neworder;
444 }

1068  {
1069  std::string name = path;
1070  const size_t lastDot = name.find_last_of('.');
1071  // file has no extension
1072  if (lastDot == std::string::npos) return name;

A generic factory for constraints of the form.

a ⊑ b

where a and b are variables and ⊑ is the order relation induced by their associated property space.

227 
228  Sub(const Var& a, const Var& b, const std::string& symbol) : a(a), b(b), symbol(symbol) {}
229 
230  bool update(Assignment<Var>& ass) const override {

a ⊑ b

where b is a variables, a is a value of b's property space, and ⊑ is the order relation induced by b's property space.

113  {
114  if (symbol == "=") return BinaryConstraintOp::EQ;
115  if (symbol == "!=") return BinaryConstraintOp::NE;
116  if (symbol == "<") return BinaryConstraintOp::LT;
117  if (symbol == "<=") return BinaryConstraintOp::LE;
118  if (symbol == ">=") return BinaryConstraintOp::GE;
119  if (symbol == ">") return BinaryConstraintOp::GT;
120  if (symbol == "match") return BinaryConstraintOp::MATCH;
121  if (symbol == "contains") return BinaryConstraintOp::CONTAINS;
122  if (symbol == "not_match") return BinaryConstraintOp::NOT_MATCH;
123  if (symbol == "not_contains") return BinaryConstraintOp::NOT_CONTAINS;
124  std::cout << "Unrecognised operator: " << symbol << "\n";
125  assert(false && "Unsupported Operator!");
126  return BinaryConstraintOp::__UNDEFINED__;

NullableVector<std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*> > souffle::unifyAtoms ( AstAtom *  first,
AstAtom *  second 
)

Returns the nullable vector of substitutions needed to unify the two given atoms.

If unification is not successful, the returned vector is marked as invalid. Assumes that the atoms are both of the same relation.

Definition at line 212 of file InlineRelationsTransformer.cpp.

References souffle::AstAtom::getArguments(), and reduceSubstitution().

Referenced by inlineBodyLiterals().

212  {
213  std::vector<std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*>> substitution;
214 
215  std::vector<AstArgument*> firstArgs = first->getArguments();
216  std::vector<AstArgument*> secondArgs = second->getArguments();
217 
218  // Create the initial unification equalities
219  for (size_t i = 0; i < firstArgs.size(); i++) {
220  substitution.push_back(std::make_pair(firstArgs[i], secondArgs[i]));
221  }
222 
223  // Reduce the substitutions
224  bool success = reduceSubstitution(substitution);
225  if (success) {
226  return NullableVector<std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*>>(substitution);
227  } else {
228  // Failed to unify the two atoms
229  return NullableVector<std::pair<AstArgument*, AstArgument*>>();
230  }
231 }

static const std::vector<AstSrcLocation> souffle::usesInvalidWitness ( const std::vector< AstLiteral * > &  literals,
const std::set< std::unique_ptr< AstArgument >> &  groundedArguments 
)
static

Definition at line 701 of file AstSemanticChecker.cpp.

References souffle::AstAggregator::getBodyLiterals(), getGroundedTerms(), node, and visitDepthFirst().

Referenced by souffle::AstSemanticChecker::checkWitnessProblem().

702  {
703  // Node-mapper that replaces aggregators with new (unique) variables
704  struct M : public AstNodeMapper {
705  // Variables introduced to replace aggregators
706  mutable std::set<std::string> aggregatorVariables;
707 
708  const std::set<std::string>& getAggregatorVariables() {
709  return aggregatorVariables;
710  }
711 
712  std::unique_ptr<AstNode> operator()(std::unique_ptr<AstNode> node) const override {
713  static int numReplaced = 0;
714  if (AstAggregator* aggr = dynamic_cast<AstAggregator*>(node.get())) {
715  // Replace the aggregator with a variable
716  std::stringstream newVariableName;
717  newVariableName << "+aggr_var_" << numReplaced++;
718 
719  // Keep track of which variables are bound to aggregators
720  aggregatorVariables.insert(newVariableName.str());
721 
722  return std::make_unique<AstVariable>(newVariableName.str());
723  }
724  node->apply(*this);
725  return node;
726  }
727  };
728 
729  std::vector<AstSrcLocation> result;
730 
731  // Create two versions of the original clause
732 
733  // Clause 1 - will remain equivalent to the original clause in terms of variable groundedness
734  auto originalClause = std::make_unique<AstClause>();
735  originalClause->setHead(std::make_unique<AstAtom>("*"));
736 
737  // Clause 2 - will have aggregators replaced with intrinsically grounded variables
738  auto aggregatorlessClause = std::make_unique<AstClause>();
739  aggregatorlessClause->setHead(std::make_unique<AstAtom>("*"));
740 
741  // Construct both clauses in the same manner to match the original clause
742  // Must keep track of the subnode in Clause 1 that each subnode in Clause 2 matches to
743  std::map<const AstArgument*, const AstArgument*> identicalSubnodeMap;
744  for (const AstLiteral* lit : literals) {
745  auto firstClone = std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(lit->clone());
746  auto secondClone = std::unique_ptr<AstLiteral>(lit->clone());
747 
748  // Construct the mapping between equivalent literal subnodes
749  std::vector<const AstArgument*> firstCloneArguments;
750  visitDepthFirst(*firstClone, [&](const AstArgument& arg) { firstCloneArguments.push_back(&arg); });
751 
752  std::vector<const AstArgument*> secondCloneArguments;
753  visitDepthFirst(*secondClone, [&](const AstArgument& arg) { secondCloneArguments.push_back(&arg); });
754 
755  for (int i = 0; i < firstCloneArguments.size(); i++) {
756  identicalSubnodeMap[secondCloneArguments[i]] = firstCloneArguments[i];
757  }
758 
759  // Actually add the literal clones to each clause
760  originalClause->addToBody(std::move(firstClone));
761  aggregatorlessClause->addToBody(std::move(secondClone));
762  }
763 
764  // Replace the aggregators in Clause 2 with variables
765  M update;
766  aggregatorlessClause->apply(update);
767 
768  // Create a dummy atom to force certain arguments to be grounded in the aggregatorlessClause
769  auto groundingAtomAggregatorless = std::make_unique<AstAtom>("grounding_atom");
770  auto groundingAtomOriginal = std::make_unique<AstAtom>("grounding_atom");
771 
772  // Force the new aggregator variables to be grounded in the aggregatorless clause
773  const std::set<std::string>& aggregatorVariables = update.getAggregatorVariables();
774  for (const std::string& str : aggregatorVariables) {
775  groundingAtomAggregatorless->addArgument(std::make_unique<AstVariable>(str));
776  }
777 
778  // Force the given grounded arguments to be grounded in both clauses
779  for (const std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>& arg : groundedArguments) {
780  groundingAtomAggregatorless->addArgument(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(arg->clone()));
781  groundingAtomOriginal->addArgument(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(arg->clone()));
782  }
783 
784  aggregatorlessClause->addToBody(std::move(groundingAtomAggregatorless));
785  originalClause->addToBody(std::move(groundingAtomOriginal));
786 
787  // Compare the grounded analysis of both generated clauses
788  // All added arguments in Clause 2 were forced to be grounded, so if an ungrounded argument
789  // appears in Clause 2, it must also appear in Clause 1. Consequently, have two cases:
790  // - The argument is also ungrounded in Clause 1 - handled by another check
791  // - The argument is grounded in Clause 1 => the argument was grounded in the
792  // first clause somewhere along the line by an aggregator-body - not allowed!
793  std::set<std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>> newlyGroundedArguments;
794  std::map<const AstArgument*, bool> originalGrounded = getGroundedTerms(*originalClause);
795  std::map<const AstArgument*, bool> aggregatorlessGrounded = getGroundedTerms(*aggregatorlessClause);
796  for (auto pair : aggregatorlessGrounded) {
797  if (!pair.second && originalGrounded[identicalSubnodeMap[pair.first]]) {
798  result.push_back(pair.first->getSrcLoc());
799  }
800 
801  // Otherwise, it can now be considered grounded
802  newlyGroundedArguments.insert(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(pair.first->clone()));
803  }
804 
805  // All previously grounded are still grounded
806  for (const std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>& arg : groundedArguments) {
807  newlyGroundedArguments.insert(std::unique_ptr<AstArgument>(arg->clone()));
808  }
809 
810  // Everything on this level is fine, check subaggregators of each literal
811  for (const AstLiteral* lit : literals) {
812  visitDepthFirst(*lit, [&](const AstAggregator& aggr) {
813  // Check recursively if an invalid witness is used
814  std::vector<AstLiteral*> aggrBodyLiterals = aggr.getBodyLiterals();
815  std::vector<AstSrcLocation> subresult =
816  usesInvalidWitness(aggrBodyLiterals, newlyGroundedArguments);
817  for (AstSrcLocation argloc : subresult) {
818  result.push_back(argloc);
819  }
820  });
821  }
822 
823  return result;
824 }
souffle::getGroundedTerms
std::map< const AstArgument *, bool > getGroundedTerms(const AstClause &clause)
Analyse the given clause and computes for each contained argument whether it is a grounded value or n...
Definition: AstTypeAnalysis.cpp:321
node
const RamNode & node
Definition: Synthesiser.cpp:268
souffle::usesInvalidWitness
static const std::vector< AstSrcLocation > usesInvalidWitness(const std::vector< AstLiteral * > &literals, const std::set< std::unique_ptr< AstArgument >> &groundedArguments)
Definition: AstSemanticChecker.cpp:701

967  if (::realpath(name.c_str(), buf) && isExecutable(buf)) {

const QueryExecutionStrategy souffle::DirectExecution
Initial value:
= [](
const RamInsert& insert, InterpreterEnvironment& env, std::ostream*) -> ExecutionSummary {
auto start = now();
apply(insert.getOperation(), env);
auto end = now();
return ExecutionSummary(
{Order::getIdentity(insert.getOrigin().getAtoms().size()), duration_in_ms(start, end)});
}
